00003 /**
00004  * Contains the view-Class that is used to render view-templates (layout,views,elements)
00005  *
00006  * Kata - Lightweight MVC Framework <http://www.codeninja.de/>
00007  * Copyright 2007-2009 mnt@codeninja.de, gameforge ag
00008  *
00009  * Licensed under The GPL License
00010  * Redistributions of files must retain the above copyright notice.
00011  * @package kata_view
00012  */
00013 
00014 /**
00015  * default view class. used to render the view (and layout) for the controller
00016  * @package kata_view
00017  */
00018 class View {
00019     /**
00020      * controller class that the dispatcher called
00021      * @var object
00022      */
00023     protected $controller;
00024 
00025     /**
00026      * array which holds all relevant information for the current view:
00027      * [isAjax] => false (boolean, tells you if view got called with /ajax/)
00028      * [url] => Array (
00029      *       [url] => locations
00030      *       [foo] => bar (if url read ?foo=bar)
00031      * )
00032      * [form] => Array (
00033      *    (all post-variables, automatically dequoted if needed)
00034      * )
00035      * [controller] => main (name of the controller of this request)
00036      * [action] => index (name of the view of this request)
00037      * @var array
00038      */
00039     public $params;
00040 
00041     /**
00042      * name of the action of the current controller the dispatcher called
00043      * @var string
00044      */
00045     public $action;
00046 
00047     /**
00048      * absolute filesystem path to the webroot folder
00049      * @var string
00050      */
00051     public $webroot;
00052 
00053     /**
00054      * base url of this framework
00055      * @var string
00056      */
00057     public $base;
00058 
00059     /**
00060      * array of helpers you can access inside the view via $this->helpername
00061      * @var array
00062      */
00063     public $helpers = array (
00064         "Html"
00065     );
00066 
00067     /**
00068      * array that holds the actual instanciated classes of all constructed helpers for this view
00069      */
00070     protected $helperClasses = array ();
00071 
00072     /**
00073      * name of the element that is currently rendered inside the view via $this->renderElement
00074      * @var string
00075      */
00076     protected $elementName = '';
00077 
00078     /**
00079      * name of the layout we are rendering to
00080      * @var string
00081      */
00082     protected $layoutName = '';
00083 
00084     /**
00085      * used to stop us from accidently contructing helpers twice
00086      * @var bool
00087      */
00088     protected $didConstructHelpers = false;
00089 
00090     /**
00091      * constructor. copies all needed variables from the controller
00092      * @param object controller that uses this view
00093      */
00094     function __construct(& $controller) {
00095         $this->controller = $controller;
00096         $this->params =  $controller->params;
00097         $this->action =  $controller->action;
00098         $this->webroot =  $controller->webroot;
00099         $this->helpers =  $controller->helpers;
00100         $this->base =  $controller->base;
00101         $this->basePath =  $controller->basePath;
00102     }
00103 
00104     /**
00105      * construct all helpers we found in our helpers property
00106      */
00107     protected function constructHelpers() {
00108         if ($this->didConstructHelpers) {
00109             return;
00110         }
00111         require LIB.'helper.php';
00112 
00113         foreach ($this->helpers as $name) {
00114             $name = strtolower($name);
00115             $classname = ucfirst(strtolower($name)) . 'Helper';
00116             $h = classRegistry :: getObject($classname);
00117 
00118             $h->webroot = $this->webroot;
00119             $h->action = $this->action;
00120             $h->params = $this->controller->params;
00121             $h->base = $this->base;
00122             $h->basePath = $this->basePath;
00123             $h->vars = $this->controller->viewVars;
00124 
00125             $this->helperClasses[$name] = $h;
00126         }
00127 
00128         $this->didConstructHelpers = true;
00129     }
00130 
00131     /**
00132      * render the actual view and layout. normally done at the end of a action of a controller
00133      * <code>
00134      * 1. all helpers are constructed here, very late, so we dont accidently waste cpu cycles
00135      * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00136      * 3. the actual view-template is rendered
00137      * 4. the content of the rendered view is rendered into the layout
00138      * </code>
00139      * @param string $action name of the view
00140      * @param string $layout name of the layout
00141      * @return string html of the view
00142      */
00143     public function render($action, $layout) {
00144         $this->action = $action;
00145         $this->layoutName = $layout;
00146 
00147         $this->constructHelpers();
00148         extract(array (
00149             'params' => $this->controller->params
00150         ));
00151         extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00152         extract($this->helperClasses);
00153         $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00154 
00155         $viewfile = ROOT . 'views' . DS . strtolower(substr(get_class($this->controller), 0, -10)) . DS . $this->action . ".thtml";
00156         if ($this->action[0] == '.') {
00157             $viewfile = str_replace(DS,'/',$viewfile);
00158             do {
00159                 $viewfile = preg_replace('/\w+\/\.\.\//', '', $viewfile, -1, $cnt);
00160             } while($cnt!=0);
00161             $viewfile = str_replace('/',DS,$viewfile);
00162         }
00163         
00164         ob_start();
00165         // well shirley... if you get a fatal error your view is missing ;)
00166         require $viewfile;
00167         return $this->renderLayout(ob_get_clean(), $this->layoutName);
00168     }
00169 
00170     /**
00171      * renders the given string into the layout. normally called by renderView()
00172      * <code>
00173      * 1. title and content are extracted into global namespace
00174      * 2. all variables, helpers and params given from the controller are extracted to global namespace
00175      * 3. the given string is rendered into the layout
00176      * 4. the html-output of this routine normally lands in the controllers output property
00177      * </code>
00178      * @param string $contentForLayout raw html to be rendered to the layout (normally the content of a view)
00179      * @param string $layout name of the layout
00180      */
00181     public function renderLayout($contentForLayout, $layout) {
00182         $this->layoutName = $layout; //in case $layout gets overwritten
00183         if ($this->layoutName !== null) {
00184             $this->constructHelpers();
00185 
00186             extract(array (
00187                 'content_for_layout' => $contentForLayout,
00188                 'title_for_layout' => $this->controller->pageTitle,
00189                 'this' => $this
00190             ));
00191             extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00192             extract($this->helperClasses);
00193             $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00194 
00195             ob_start();
00196 
00197             $viewfile = ROOT . 'views' . DS . 'layouts' . DS . $this->layoutName . '.thtml';
00198             if ($this->layoutName[0] == '.') {
00199                 $viewfile = str_replace(DS,'/',$viewfile);
00200                 do {
00201                     $viewfile = preg_replace('/\w+\/\.\.\//', '', $viewfile, -1, $cnt);
00202                 } while($cnt!=0);
00203                 $viewfile = str_replace('/',DS,$viewfile);
00204             } 
00205 
00206 
00207             // well shirley... if you get a fatal error your layout is missing ;)
00208             require $viewfile;
00209             return ob_get_clean();
00210         } else {
00211             return $contentForLayout;
00212         }
00213     }
00214 
00215     /**
00216      * render a element and return the resulting html. an element is kind of like a mini-view you can use inside a view (via $this->renderElement()).
00217      * it has (like a view) access to all variables a normal view has
00218      * @param string $name name of the element (see views/elements/) without .thtml
00219      * @param an array of variables the element can access in global namespace
00220      */
00221     public function renderElement($name, $params = array ()) {
00222         $this->elementName = $name; //in case $name gets overwritten 
00223         extract($this->controller->viewVars);
00224         extract($params);
00225         extract($this->helperClasses);
00226         $GLOBALS['__THIS'] = $this;
00227 
00228         ob_start();
00229         require ROOT . 'views' . DS . 'elements' . DS . $this->elementName . '.thtml';
00230         return ob_get_clean();
00231     }
00232 
00233 }
